channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Gerry Adams wins Supreme Court appeal against convictions
item.description: Ulster Unionist Party justice spokesperson, Doug Beattie, has called for an inquiry into Gerry Adams' activities during the Troubles after the ex-Sinn Fein leader won his Supreme Court battle.

item.title: Meghan Markle kept a DIARY of her time in the UK, friend claims
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: This summer sees the publication of Finding Freedom, the book hyped as going 'beyond the headlines' of Prince Harry and Meghan's life together.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Adviser sceptical on 1 June school reopening
item.description: Teachers' unions have slammed the Government over a fear that opening schools could risk spreading coronavirus despite previous claims children cannot infect others.

item.title: New coronavirus antibody test found to have 100%...
item.description: Public Health England (PHE) have revealed that experts looking at Roche's new antibody blood test at Porton Down science facility found that it was 'highly specific' and had an accuracy of 100 per cent.

item.title: CALVIN ROBINSON on why teachers MUST get back in class
item.description: CALVIN ROBINSON: The most important resource in my classroom is not state-of-the-art computers, the overhead projector or interactive whiteboard. It's me. The teacher.

item.title: MMR jabs have plunged by a QUARTER since coronavirus lockdown, new research shows
item.description: The number of children who were given the MMR jab fell by 3,500. London and the West Midlands saw the lowest immunisation rates in the country during the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Poverty won't cure corona... we MUST get back to work, writes hotel chain magnate SIR ROCCO FORTE
item.description: SIR ROCCO FORTE: The lockdown is an expensive and potentially deadly overreaction which should be brought to an end as soon as possible.

item.title: Up to 100 British children have had a mysterious inflammatory disease linked to COVID-19
item.description: Doctors from Imperial College Healthcare and the Royal College of Paediatrics and Child Health today said that the syndrome seems to appear up to a month after COVID-19 infection.

item.title: Probation staff failings 'put public in danger', damning new report warns
item.description: Chief Inspector of Probation Justin Russel says internal checks are not sufficient. He says: 'The Government and probation services are not doing enough to learn from past mistakes.'

item.title: HENRY DEEDES: So much for national unity...
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: By tea-time, furious letters were being exchanged. Starmer demanded Boris return to the Chamber and 'correct the record'. The PM wanted a retraction.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Cleaner drops clients who didn't pay in lockdown
item.description: An anonymous woman from the UK, told Mumsnet she doesn't want to return to cleaning for clients who didn't pay her during lockdown, and some agreed she doesn't 'owe them anything'.

item.title: Man stabbed to death in brawl on London street 30 minutes before four men injured four miles away
item.description: Police were called to a fatal stabbing in Southwark today, 30 minutes before four men were injured in a car crash and stabbing four miles away. It is not clear if the incidents are connected.

item.title: Women who get a caffeine fix two or three times a day have less body fat than those who drink none
item.description: Women who enjoy two or three cups of coffee a day have less body fat than those who drink less or none at all. Coffee may contain compounds with anti-obesity properties that cause body fat to fall.

item.title: Zoe Ball has lost a MILLION listeners from Radio 2 breakfast show
item.description: Figures released today show that in the first quarter of this year she had 8.11million weekly listeners, down from 9.05million in the same period last year when she started.

item.title: Screening ALL middle-aged men for prostate cancer would pick up 8,000 extra cases
item.description: The breakthrough study, by experts at Imperial College London, could pave the way for Britain's first prostate screening programme.

item.title: Coronavirus could take FIVE YEARS to bring under control warns WHO's chief scientist
item.description: Soumya Swaminathan, the WHO's chief scientist, told the FT's Global Boardroom digital conference that the virus could be 'under control' within a four to five-year timeframe.

item.title: Britain has hit its 'taxable limit', a former minister warns the Government
item.description: Tax rises and curbs to state pensions could be needed to help fix a £300billion black hole in the public finances, Downing Street acknowledged this evening.

item.title: Boris Johnson and Kier Starmer clash over 10,000 care home deaths
item.description: Labour leader criticised PM over official guidance from February which he said advised 'it remains very unlikely that people receiving care in a care home will become infected'.

item.title: About blooming time! Britons flock to garden centres as they re-open following coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Wednesday saw garden centres reopen in the UK for the first time in seven weeks. The government announced easing of certain lockdown measures last week .

item.title: 80% of children in Italian hospital with rare inflammatory disorder tested positive for coronavirus
item.description: A new study from Lombardy, Italy, found that 10 children were admitted to a hospital with Kawasaki Disease-like symptoms over the last two months compared to 19 over the last five years.

item.title: More than a QUARTER of most-viewed COVID-19 videos on YouTube contain fake or misleading information
item.description: Previous research has shown that YouTube has been both a help and a hindrance in earlier public health crises - for example, during the swine flu pandemic and the Ebola and Zika outbreaks.

item.title: Navy fighter jets intercepted eight UFOs and even locked on to one with air-to-air missiles
item.description: Eight hazard reports filed with the Naval Safety Center were released under the Freedom of Information Act and detail strange encounters between Navy pilots and unidentified flying objects.

item.title: Buyers are demanding big discounts as housing market bursts back into life following lockdown
item.description: Estate agents reported a surge in demand yesterday after ministers lifted a seven-week ban on home moves. But experts warned of a 'Mexican standoff' as fears linger over a price crash.

item.title: Florida skydivers are critically injured after their parachute malfunctioned and they hit a tree
item.description: Two men were doing a tandem jump from a plane that took off from Dunn Airpark on Wednesday morning and witnesses filmed the moment they fell after their parachute malfunctioned.

item.title: Who'll find love on our virtual date? This week it's Ysabelle, 29, and Archie, 29,
item.description: Every week during lockdown, FEMAIL sends two UK singletons on a virtual blind date and asks them to report back. Ysabelle, 29, and Archie, 29, shared their experience.

item.title: TOM LEONARD charts the rise and fall of Siegfried and Roy as one half of the dynamic duo dies at 75
item.description: TOM LEONARD: They called it 'The Rapport' - the part of the show intended to demonstrate the incredible bond between man and big cat. But on a night in October 2003, that telepathic link failed him.

item.title: Jersey government minister drinks white wine during health panel meeting on Zoom
item.description: Scott Wickenden, 42, was taking part in a video meeting of the Health and Social Security Scrutiny Panel from his home in Jersey via Zoom, when he was seen sipping a tall glass of white wine.

item.title: Writer PHILLIPE SANDS tells the astonishing story of an SS general who murdered his relatives
item.description: The Ratline podcast presenter Phillippe Sands reveals the story of Otto Wachter and his surviving son Horst. The SS general from Lake Zell in central Austria murdered his relatives in WW2.

item.title: Disgraced Lance Armstrong to tell 'his truth' about steroid use in upcoming ESPN documentary
item.description: Disgraced former Tour de France champion Lance Armstrong is opening up about the truth behind his use of performance-enhancing drugs - or at least his version of the truth.

item.title: Virginia Roberts Giuffre warns Jeffrey Epstein's accomplices 'we're going to take your freedom'
item.description: Four part series 'Filthy Rich' will air May 27. Epstein, bottom inset, killed himself in August. Roberts Giuffre is main and inset with Prince Andrew.

item.title: Mother suffering from coronavirus 'collapsed to the ground in agony' before giving birth to a boy
item.description: Mother Kimberly Phillips, 44, had tested positive for coronavirus. Coolio Carl Justin Morgan was born at the Princess of Wales Hospital in Bridgend, south Wales, with a low heart rate on May 2.

item.title: Two retired women spoken to by police amid claims they blocked cyclist paths with rocks and branches
item.description: Officers acted after mountain biker Nathan Cartwright, 17, found his path blocked with rocks and branches. Two women openly admitted they had put them there to stop cyclists.

item.title: Pick up a perfect picnic (yes, you are allowed)!
item.description: Angela Epstein gives her verdict on the best hampers as the UK prepares for another weekend of sunny weather. She says a picnic is great for celebrating the easing of lockdown.

item.title: Uber will use 'face detection technology' to ensure all drivers and riders wear masks
item.description: Drivers will have to take selfies showing they are wearing a mask before going online, and if they are not wearing one they won't be able to pick up passengers, the company said.

item.title: Argentina cops arrest the 'drug dealing parents' of a 10-month-old girl who consumed cocaine
item.description: Police arrested Yamila R. and Ismael A. at their Buenos Aires home Tuesday after their daughter tested positive for cocaine during an emergency hospital visit Saturday.

item.title: Tottenham and England star Dele Alli held at knifepoint during burglary
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY SAMI MOKBEL: Dele Alli was held at knifepoint and punched after robbers broke into his house during the early hours of Wednesday morning.

item.title: Would you BREAK lockdown to save your locks?
item.description: Antonia Mariconda who is the founder of Safety In Beauty, conducted an anonymous investigation into the UK beauticians and hairdressers that are continuing to offer services during lockdown.

item.title: Time to give your fragrance a spring clean
item.description: Jo Fairley examines the surge in demand for clean fragrances, as Calvin Klein debuts a unisex scent that has been independently verified as clean and environmentally conscious.

item.title: Meghan Markle's friend Misha Nonoo says she's 'not going anywhere' but is seen returning to NYC
item.description: Misha Nonoo, a British-Bahraini fashion designer, known for her eponymous clothing line, was seen wheeling her newborn son Leo into her Manhattan home on Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: After claims she is worth nearly £500million, just how did popstar Rihanna get so rich?
item.description: She's the pop star who's richer than Elton John, lives next door to Sir Paul McCartney in London and has gone from being a teenage 'one-hit wonder' to a globally successful fashion and beauty mogul.

item.title: How to put the pep back in your marriage by Gwenyth's guru
item.description: Gwyneth Paltrow and Brad Falchuk, turned to intimacy coach Michaela Boehm while self-isolating. Anna Maxted and Phil Robinson shared their experience of having a session with the California based therapist.

item.title: 25 reasons not to miss going to clothes shops
item.description: Department stores, clothes and shoe shops have been closed across the UK for nearly two months. Claudia Connell explains why she's in no rush to visit a clothes shop.

item.title: Fall in love with linen again: Forget boring beige, think rainbow brights
item.description: Jess Wood shared her advice for embracing this season's linen fashion trend. The British style expert says linen is perfect for summer because it's a natural fibre and conducts heat away from the body.

item.title: FRANCES HARDY describes the recent funeral of her family's adored Granny Madeline
item.description: Frances Hardy who was one of six mourners to attend Granny Madeline's funeral, reflects on saying her last goodbyes. The 98-year-old died in March and was buried at Bournemouth cemetery.

item.title: The moment I realised I'd happily die for my stepdaughter
item.description: Jenny Parrott reflects on the upbringing of her stepchildren Louis and Josie, who she met after their parents divorced. British writer explains that being their stepmother feels like an honour.

item.title: Is it OK for NHS staff to post daft videos at work?
item.description: Kate Spicer and Clare Foges debate the backlash NHS staff across the UK have received for uploading footage of themselves dancing on the social media app TikTok.

item.title: SUSANNA REID: Why mums fear the moment they have to let their quaranteens go
item.description: British presenter Susanna Reid, reflects on having the opportunity to spend time with her sons during lockdown. She admits to being heart-broken every time she speaks to Harry Dunn's mother.

item.title: Belly Mujinga's family tell of their shattering loss, and demand answers... and justice
item.description: Belly Mujinga, 47, a ticket officer at London's Victoria Station, died from coronavirus after a man who claimed to have Covid-19 spat in her face and then ran off.

item.title: Holiday corona-cancelled? The stunning staycation locations in Britain that look like they're abroad
item.description: As Matt Hancock said, it's not looking rosy for Britons as far as summer holidays abroad are concerned. But there is some good news - Britain is peppered with spell-binding spots that look like they're abroad.

item.title: Facebook settlement suggests HALF of company's moderators developed mental health issues from work
item.description: The level of current and former employees affected by mental health disorders was determined with the help of experts in post-traumatic and vicarious trauma according to The Verge .

item.title: Japanese researchers unveil INFLATABLE e-bike that weighs 12 pounds and fits inside a backpack
item.description: Researchers in Japan have developed a new twist on the electric bike that's small enough to carry in a backpack, weighs just 12 pounds, and can be inflated in around a minute.

item.title: Study finds that doing regular exercise helps older people boost their mental agility
item.description: Researchers from the University of Calgary say older adults perform better on thinking and memory tests after just six months of aerobic exercise.

item.title: Triple-drug combo of hydroxychloroquine, azithromycin and ZINC helped COVID-19 patients
item.description: A new study from NYU Grossman found that patients who got a combination of zinc, hydroxychloroquine and azithromycin were more likely to recover and less likely to die.

item.title: Child sexual abuse in Muslim communities is 'underreported', say Britain's big Islamic authorities
item.description: The Independent Inquiry into Child Sexual Abuse (IICSA) is looking at how institutions have failed to protect children from sexual abuse and to help ensure better safeguarding for children in the future.

item.title: Racing chiefs confirm Royal Ascot will start as scheduled on June 16 - but WITHOUT fans present
item.description: Royal Ascot will start on its scheduled date of Tuesday, June 16 amid a glut of top-class racing that was on Wednesday night confirmed for the first five weeks of the return of sport.

item.title: Model suffers horrific burns after a bottle of tanning oil exploded in a freak accident
item.description: Kym Graham, 27,from Heaton, was left with horrific burns down her arm after she mistakenly dropped a bottle of tanning oil in a garden fire at home, which exploded.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Beauty spots swamped as lockdown eased
item.description: Tourists were seen weathering the overcast conditions at popular destinations such as Durdle Door in Dorset (pictured), Ilkley Moor near Bradford and in the Lake District.

item.title: Holidaymakers should be given vouchers for MORE than the original cost of travel
item.description: Disappointed travellers are legally entitled to a speedy refund, but this is not happening due to the dire financial circumstances businesses are finding themselves in.

item.title: Loose Women slams Meghan Markle and Prince Harry for book
item.description: The Loose Women panelists tore into Prince Harry and Meghan Markle on their Wednesday show, for releasing a new book.

item.title: Donald Trump blames falling markets on 'rich guys' betting it will go down
item.description: President Donald Trump blamed 'rich guys' playing the market for the up and down swings among stocks after legendary investor Stanley Druckenmiller said a fast recovery was a 'fantasy.'

item.title: Man who allegedly let the Manchester Arena bomber's brother use his bank details charged with fraud
item.description: Yahya Werfalli, 25, from Cheetham Hill, Manchester, was charged with two counts of fraud by false representation after Hashem Abedi (left) used his bank account to purchase chemicals.

item.title: Police officer slaps dangerous driving suspect in face in video
item.description: A video circulating on social media of a police officer punching a man in the face on a road in Blackpool is being investigated by Lancashire Police.

item.title: Terrifying moment slam into car at speed in huge crash after fighting with bats and knives
item.description: The shocking scene happened on Wilbraham Road in Chorlton, Manchester last Wednesday. A black Audi slammed into a parked white car after a fight broke out at 6.20pm.

item.title: Make it a mane event! Katy Perry's new go-to accessory is a video conferencing hair solution
item.description: While most of us aren't making getting dressed a priority these days, thanks to video conferencing, we are thinking about our beauty look. Katy Perry has been styling her tresses with turbans.

item.title: Building sites will operate until 9pm to get economy running
item.description: Housing Secretary Robert Jenrick said extending the hours for construction would take pressure off the transport system and improve social distancing.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll hits 33,186 with 494 new fatalities
item.description: Today's statistics covering people who died in hospitals, care homes and private houses around the UK come after separate figures yesterday suggested the true death toll was over 50,000.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Barrow-in-Furness, Cumbria has highest case rate
item.description: At least 552 people in Barrow-in-Furness, Cumbria, have been infected with the killer disease - giving the small industrial town of 67,000 people a rate of 882 cases per 100,000.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Contract tracing may mean 770k self-isolate a day
item.description: Contact tracing could impact thousands of people every day, according to researchers from the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine (LSHTM).

item.title: Shocked mourners believe person in a coffin was buried alive
item.description: Mourners were able to view the corpse during the funeral in Manado, North Sulawesi, Indonesia because the body was being buried in a coffin with a glass panel on the front.

item.title: Cold War atomic bomb tests in Nevada changed rainfall patterns in the UK
item.description: Researchers from the University of Reading studied Shetland rainfall data from 1962 and 1964 as the island is generally 'unaffected by other man made pollution'.

item.title: Russian oligarch's ex-wife says their son has played 'central role' in putting £450m beyond reach
item.description: Tatiana Akhmedova, 52, the former wife of the Russian businessman Farkhad Akhmedov, was awarded a 41.5 per cent share of his £1 billion-plus fortune by Mr Justice Haddon-Cave in late 2016.

item.title: Sausage dog lost on farm for three days is reunited with owners after they enticed him with BACON
item.description: Floyd, a seven-month old miniature sausage dog, was lost at a family farm in Middleton Tyas, North Yorkshire. He was reunited with his owners Fern Holmes, 32, and Doug Dinwiddie on Monday.

item.title: Pair arrested on suspicion of murder after human remains found
item.description: A section of the A4136 was closed off near to Stowfield Quarry, Glocs, after human remains were discovered. Police have arrested a man and woman on suspicion of murder.

item.title: First official portraits of Prince Charles of Luxembourg
item.description: Grand Duke Guillaume, 38, and Hereditary Grand Duchess Stéphanie of Luxembourg, 35, were captured leaving the Grand Duchess Charlotte Maternity Hospital in Luxembourg, today.

item.title: Angela Merkel says she has 'hard evidence' Russia are carrying out 'outrageous' attempts to hack her
item.description: Angela Merkel told parliament: 'I can honestly say that it pains me. Every day I try to build a better relationship with Russia but there is such hard evidence that Russian forces are doing this.'

item.title: UK Temperatures to return to 71F for the weekend with barely any rain
item.description: The UK can expect warmer weather rolling in just in time for the weekend, after a temperamental period which saw temperatures around the country plummet to sub-zero.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Houses flood property market as crash expected
item.description: Some 2,150 properties have been added to RightMove in England, Wales and Scotland over the past 24 hours as Robert Jenrick lifted the ban on house moves.

item.title: Woman leaves a banana locked in her office drawer for nine weeks
item.description: This is the moment a woman in Scotland returned to her office for the first time in nine weeks having left behind a banana in her desk drawer.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Keir Starmer slams Boris Johnson data omission
item.description: The global death toll comparison graph has been a fixture of the daily Number 10 press conference during the outbreak. But the slide was not released yesterday.

item.title: Irish hairdresser creates innovative chair to protect clients from coronavirus
item.description: Jean McDonnell, a hairdresser from Drogheda, County Lough in Ireland, created an innovative chair featuring perspex screen to protect clients from coronavirus

item.title: What is project 'Warp Speed'? US scientist reveals government plan for coronavirus vaccines
item.description: Operation Warp Speed is a fast-track plan by the US government to push funding and additional resources for eight coronavirus vaccine candidates so human trials can begin in July.

item.title: Thug who killed Garry Newlove will NOT be freed from prison after cell party
item.description: Jordan Cunliffe (pictured) murdered father-of-two Garry Newlove outside his home in Warrington, Cheshire, and the Parole Board was considering his release until he had a party in his open prison.

item.title: How do I un-SORN a car and can I now drive again?
item.description: With the Government allowing people to drive unlimited distances within England to visit parks, beaches and other locations to exercise, some owners will want to un-SORN vehicles pronto.

item.title: Police search for London woman seen forced into car at night
item.description: Officers were called to New River Avenue in Haringey, north London, at 11.55pm on May 11 to reports that someone was bundled into a small dark coloured car and driven away.

item.title: Male coronavirus patients with low testosterone levels are MORE likely to die from COVID-19
item.description: Researchers assessed the hormone levels of the first 45 laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 patients who were admitted to the ICU at the University Medical Center Hamburg-Eppendorf.

item.title: Granddaughter shares the mug shot of her Channing Tatum doppelganger grandfather
item.description: Valerie Paolini learned of her grandfather Ocie Haskell Jones's incredible past while being stuck inside due to the coronavirus. He bears a striking resemblance to Channing Tatum.

item.title: Investigators refuse to drop murder charges against three Russian sisters who killed 'rapist' father
item.description: Krestina, Angelina and Maria Khachaturyan - aged 19, 18 and 17 when they killed Mikhail Khachaturyan, 57, in Moscow in July 2018 - said they suffered years of 'torture and sexual abuse.'

item.title: Unions demand the government 'steps back' from opening schools on June 1
item.description: A joint statement issued through the Trades Union Congress complains of a 'lack of understanding' of the risks faced by teachers and children, with no provision for social distancing.

item.title: Back to work day: Commuters pack onto Tube and trains
item.description: The City of London Corporation claims closing major routes through the financial district will be 'pivotal' to keeping people safe as the coronavirus lockdown is eased and people come back to work.

item.title: Mastercard faces Supreme Court over £14bn damages claim
item.description: Former financial ombudsman Walter Merricks is taking Mastercard to court, claiming unlawful fees it charged shops between 1992 and 2008 resulted in consumers paying more.

item.title: UK faces 'recession to end all recessions' with GDP set to plunge 30%
item.description: The IFS think-tank said the scale of the nose-dive due to coronavirus lockdown will be like nothing seen before, while the NIESR forecast that UK plc will shrink by 25-30 per cent in the current quarter.

item.title: Jacob Rees-Mogg tells MPs they cannot 'hide away' because of coronavirus
item.description: The Commons is currently using a 'hybrid' set up which allows 50 MPs to attend proceedings in the chamber while up to 120 can take part remotely using Zoom video conferencing software.

item.title: Sweden records highest number of coronavirus deaths for three weeks
item.description: Sweden has recorded 147 new deaths today, reaching 3,460 deaths. There are also 637 new cases, totalling 27,909 coronavirus cases. This is the country's most deaths in three weeks.

item.title: Twitter and BT could make working home permanent, amid concern over demise of traditional offices
item.description: Britain's biggest commercial landlord, Land Securities, has warned commercial rents could plunge by three quarters as employees adapt to working from home and companies try to cut costs after the lockdown.

item.title: China's 'mystical turtle' appears: Tourists flock to get a rare glimpse of vivid island
item.description: The spectacular outcrop, spotted in southwestern city Chongqing, recently emerged from the Yangtze River after the rising temperature drove the water to an extremely low level.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Bosses warn of job losses once furlough ends
item.description: Industry experts also claim Chancellor Rishi Sunak's extension to the Job Retention Scheme - where the Treasury bankrolls 80 per cent of wages - is merely delaying redundancies.

item.title: Ed Sheeran wouldn't have made it in the 1980s because he's not good looking enough, Kim Wilde says
item.description: The Kids in America singer, 59, said 29-year-old Sheeran is 'not quite as easy on the eye as George Michael was', and told Platinum magazine she saw a UFO fly over her Hertfordshire garden.

item.title: More people trying naturism during lockdown
item.description: More time indoors is encouraging people to try disrobing, says British Naturism, with fans of naked living posting photos on Instagram of themselves making cups of tea and doing yoga.

item.title: Europe's OLDEST time capsule - dating back to 1797 - is discovered hidden in a Polish church spire
item.description: A capsule dating back to 1797 was found in a church spire by workers renovating the building in the town Ziebice, Poland. Town officials found 200-year-old coins and documents in German.

item.title: How to speak teen: From eye-rolling to saying 'Whatever
item.description: In What's My Teenager Thinking? Practical Child Psychology for Modern Parents, published this week, a parenting expert and a clinical psychologist reveal how to decode your teen's language.

item.title: 100-year-old filmed talking about life in lockdown leaves viewers in disbelief with youthful looks
item.description: War veteran Owen Filer, from Cwmbran, turns 101 later this year but left many viewers tuning into an ITV interview with him struggling to believe he was a 'day over 80'.

item.title: Toddlers have severely deformed heads after being raised on 'fake baby formula', report reveals
item.description: Pictures provided by devastated parents show their children's foreheads having unusual swellings after they were raised on a protein drink falsely sold to their parents as formula in Hunan province.

item.title: Fascinating colourised video shows residents of Beijing in the 1920s
item.description: The intriguing footage, which captured the lively street scenes in the capital city, was brought back to life with artificial intelligence technology by Wengu Eddy Hu, a 28-year-old Chinese artist.

item.title: He's no wife-beater! Johnny Depp's ex-lover Vanessa Paradis dismisses Amber Heard's abuse claims
item.description: Lawyers for Mr Depp are seeking to admit evidence from Vanessa Paradis, who has two children with the star, as part of his case which is due to be tried at the High Court in London in July.

item.title: Coronavirus started spreading among the British public BEFORE the first two people tested positive
item.description: Scientists in Brazil and Uruguay predicted that the virus started to spread in the UK on January 29, the day before the first two patients tested positive and five weeks before the first person died.

item.title: Royal Family 'see photography as their very own superpower' reveals expert
item.description: British historian Lucy Worsley, who is chief curator at the Historic Royal Palaces, told The Times that the royal family view 'photography as their very own superpower'.

item.title: Taylor Wimpey gives NHS staff 5% discount on new home
item.description: Only one family will be able to view a property at a time and customers will not be accompanied by a member of the group's sales team on viewings.

item.title: Man attacked ex who dumped him for writing a 'to do' list which included getting an STD test
item.description: Melanie Consiglio, of Washington, Tyne and Wear, says she hit 'rock bottom' and was scarred for life by the seven-hour attack carried about by Chris Graham, who was jailed for 32 months.

item.title: Police seize £130,000 bright green Lamborghini super car
item.description: The Gallardo Spyder, which cost £130,000 new and has a lurid mirror paint finish, was found in the garage of a house in Croydon, south London which officers targeted in a series of dawn raids.

item.title: Two women banned from foodbank after filling bags with canned goods 'SIX times in one day'
item.description: The two women were captured on CCTV at Newton Deli on Wargrave Road in Newton-le-Willows, Merseyside on Saturday, where staff claimed they returned five more times later that day.

item.title: 'Appalled' union bosses say public sector pay freeze 'would be a slap in the face'
item.description: Chairman of the Police Federation of England and Wales John Apter called any move 'morally bankrupt' and urged the Government to rethink plans to 'punish workers' (pictured on Thursday).

item.title: Hopes raised for summer holidays as EU vows to lift travel restrictions
item.description: European countries have been urged to drop travel bans and border closures as soon as possible to kick-start the continent's ailing tourism industry and salvage what is left of the summer season.

item.title: JANET STREET-PORTER: Coronavirus kills more men than women but women are bearing brunt of the misery
item.description: JANET STREET-PORTER: The majority of coronavirus victims are male - probably because men are more likely to suffer from high blood pressure and heart disease.

item.title: Homeowner films playful baby foxes in his Suffolk back garden
item.description: An adorable family of foxes have provided a different kind of entertainment during the coronavirus lockdown. Adam Sadler, from Ipswich, Suffolk, found five young cubs in garden.

item.title: Coronavirus test results from thousands of people are 'disappearing into a black hole'
item.description: Authorities across the country say they can no longer access data for tests conducted outside NHS hospitals which helps them control outbreaks locally.

item.title: Huge queues outside McDonald's after fast-food chain reopened 15 branches
item.description: McDonald's has opened its first 15 sites from 11am in the south-east for deliveries only - and they were swamped with UberEats and Deliveroo workers who were waiting for them to start serving.

item.title: Marks & Spencer to reopen 49 cafes for takeaway hot drinks
item.description: Social distancing precautions and 'extra hygiene' measures will be in place at the reopened cafes, and staff will have to wash their hands at least every half an hour.

item.title: Real care home death toll in England and Wales could be as high as 22,000
item.description: Official data yesterday showed more than 8,000 COVID-19-related deaths in care homes had been recorded in the two countries by the start of May, but experts say there are considerably more.

item.title: Fitness influencer, 73, racks up 750,000 followers after showing off her weight loss journey
item.description: Joan MacDonald, 73, from Ontario, Canada began her fitness journey three years ago and has since shed more than 65lbs through a health diet and exercise, combined with meditation and gardening.

item.title: Mike Tindall reveals he 'dislikes' being famous in BBC Two's I'll Get This'
item.description: Mike Tindall, 41, appeared in last night's episode of BBC Two's 'I'll Get This' - and revealed he likes a rave and caviar, but dislikes being famous.

item.title: Mother is told breastfeeding her son could have KILLED him after he was diagnosed with rare syndrome
item.description: Little Jack Humphreys was diagnosed with Nephrogenic Syndrome of Inappropriate Antidiuresis at Leeds General Infirmary, a condition thought to affect just 40 people across the globe.

item.title: China's CCTV to continue to shun NBA games
item.description: China Central Television (CCTV) is refuting rumors that it would begin airing NBA games again when the league returns from the coronavirus hiatus, continuing a policy enacted last October.

item.title: Will the NHS contact tracing app be ready next week? Expert would be 'very surprised'
item.description: Gus Hosein, a member of the NHS Covid-19 App Data Ethics Advisory Board, said the trial on the Isle of Wight had not been long enough, having started on May 5.

item.title: Shocking moment yobs armed with baseball bats and PITCHFORKS charge at rivals gang
item.description: The shocking clip, filmed at around 6.40pm on Sunday, captures a group of young men as they charge through a residential street in east London wielding spades and sledgehammers.

item.title: Heart-breaking photo of children forced to play in 'isolation zones' sparks outcry in France
item.description: The image, taken in the town of Tourcoing near the French border with Belgium, shows three and four-year-old children playing inside chalk squares amid coronavirus social distancing.

item.title: Coronation Street is in the 'final stages of a return-to-production protocol'
item.description: The hit ITV soap exclusively told MailOnline that it is in 'active discussions with the government' and is working with 'others across the industry' to return.

item.title: 'Rudderless' Prince Harry is 'missing having a structure to his life'
item.description: Prince Harry, 35, feels 'a bit rudderless' and is 'missing having a structure to his life', a source told Vanity Fair's Katie Nicholl. The Duke is currently living in LA with Meghan Markle, 38.

item.title: Incredible moment tourist is able to pet a baby whale that swims right up to her boat
item.description: The wonderful interaction was caught on camera during a whale watching trip in Baja California. Sofia Sandoval Isaac was the lucky explorer to pet the curious baby sea beast.

item.title: Mother, 35, gives birth to triplets
item.description: Hayley Wilkie, 35, and husband Chris, 36, from Redditch, Worcestershire, were already parents to daughter Luna, four, when they welcomed triplet girls Polly, Ivy and Vivi on April 16.

item.title: UK economy shrank 2% in first quarter of 2020 after plunging 5.8% in March
item.description: The UK economy contracted by 2% in the first quarter of 2020 after plunging 5.8% in March as the coronavirus crisis took hold, the ONS has said.

item.title: Grant Shapps: Book a summer holiday at your own risk
item.description: The Transport Secretary suggested people could book at their own risk as he said they 'will just have to take a view on where we will be at some point in the future'.

item.title: New 'food porn' advert for Swisse Me healthy smoothies featuring fruit being handled 'seductively'
item.description: The 30-second advert, produced by London-based creative agency PLAY, features a medley of fruit as it is seductively handled on its way to becoming a smoothie.

item.title: Benefits cheat conned taxpayers out of £90,000 while competing in speedway and gym teaching
item.description: A court heard how Stephen Hodgkinson, of Smethwick, West Mids, had claimed he needed round-the-clock care, was confined to a wheelchair and could only walk with assistance.

item.title: Mother, 26, warns against Britons buying hot tubs in lockdown
item.description: Jemma Hamilton, 26, from North Lanarkshire, claims her daughter Amelia picked up the infection from the family's hot tub, despite being careful to keep it clean and check the water pH daily.

item.title: Duffy admits she feels 'liberated' after revealing harrowing four-week kidnap and rape ordeal
item.description: Duffy said she feels 'liberated' after revealing her harrowing four-week rape and kidnap ordeal in an emotional message to fans.

item.title: Cruelty and neglect of girl, six, could have been prevented if care agencies had been 'more alert'
item.description: The child - named as Megan to protect her identity - is now living in a foster placement and is doing well, according to the Gloucestershire Safeguarding Children's Board (GCSB).

item.title: Middle class brands loved by socialites and royals sell masks - with some costing up to £35
item.description: Luxury British labels loved by members of the royal family have changed their focus from trendy fashion to stylish masks and face coverings amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Thrifty woman gives her room a stunning makeover for just £90
item.description: Jade Williamson, from Northern Ireland, took to the Facebook page Extreme Couponing and Bargains UK , to reveal how she took advantage of lockdown to update her bedroom.

item.title: Could YOUR Ikea furniture be worth a fortune?
item.description: Auctioneers and retailers in the UK, US and Sweden reported how Ikea furniture from the 1950s to the 1990s can sell for hundreds of times the original price.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... seeing your loved ones again
item.description: 'Little red riding hood was ALREADY regretting adding Grandma to her friendship bubble'
